channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Want less screen-obsessed kids? Set better tech boundaries for yourself
item.description: There's a lot of talk about how to monitor screen time for kids. But for kids to have healthy relationships with technology and smartphones, parents n...

item.title: An NPR reporter's journey into Gaza, for the first time since the war began
item.description: NPR's Israel correspondent Daniel Estrin has entered the Gaza Strip for the first time since the war began, but Israeli still requires a military esco...

item.title: The shutdown continues, but politics persists. That gives this quiz a lot of fodder
item.description: Here are a bunch of questions about politics and one about bears.

item.title: What's happening with furniture prices? A tale of $399 couches and tariffs
item.description: Competition, whether from overseas rivals or second-hand goods, has kept the price of furniture relatively low. New tariffs may boost U.S. makers — an...

item.title: Support for Israel among U.S. conservatives is starting to crack. Here's why
item.description: For a decade, political support for Israel has come from conservative Christians. But now isolationism and antisemitism are changing the tone.

item.title: Multiple people fall ill after package delivered to Air Force One base
item.description: The building the package was opened in was evacuated and those taken ill were found to be stable.

item.title: Fifty-four people injured in mosque blast at Jakarta high school
item.description: Authorities say the explosion occurred during Friday prayers at a mosque inside a high school complex.

item.title: Kenya demands safety for its citizens after Tanzania's post-poll crackdown
item.description: Some Kenyans have reportedly been killed, injured and others detained by Tanzanian security officers.

item.title: 11/6: The Takeout with Major Garrett
item.description: FAA to cut flights at 40 major airports due to ongoing government shutdown; President Trump teases cutting off funds to NYC after saying he would "hel...

item.title: Elon Musk's $1tn pay deal approved by Tesla shareholders
item.description: The richest man in the world will get hundreds of millions of new shares if he hits his targets.

item.title: New U.S. strike on alleged drug boat kills3, death toll at 70
item.description: Pentagon chief Pete Hegseth released aerial footage of the latest strike, which he said took place in international waters like the previous attacks.

item.title: Crews are working to fix Alaska Native villages devastated by flooding. But will residents return?
Sudan's civil war rages despite Trump administration's push for peace
item.description: Explosions were reported near Sudan's capital Khartoum just hours after the RSF paramilitary forces said they agreed to a U.S.-backed truce proposal.

item.title: China launches new aircraft carrier in naval race with the US
item.description: The Fujian uses electromagnetic catapults that allow planes to strike from a greater distance.

item.title: Photos of the aftermath of devastating floods in remote Alaska Native villages
The FAA’s order to cut flights nationwide due to the government shutdown is set to take effect
item.description: The Federal Aviation Administration’s order to scale back flights nationwide because of the government shutdown starts Friday.

item.title: FAA order cutting thousands of flights kicks in as airlines scramble to comply
item.description: The FAA ordered airlines to cut thousands of flights as the agency deals with air traffic controller shortages during the government shutdown. The cut...

item.title: Evasive moves needed moments after 2 jets take off from LAX
item.description: American Airlines confirms the incident between one of its planes and an ITA plane at LAX last Friday.
